items.title: “To Eat This Big Universe as Her Oyster”: Margaret Fuller and the First Major Work of American Feminism
items.excerpt: Woman in the Nineteenth Century (1845). With an ear attuned to the transcendentalist’s inimitable voice, Randall Fuller revisits the intellectual context, interviews with female prison inmates, and personal longing that informed this landmark feminist work." data-gatsby-head="…

items.title: The Man and The Crowd (1928): Photography, Film, and Fate
items.excerpt: The Crowd had already been made, so why remake it?” Gideon Leek rewatches King Vidor’s classic, in which a young man with big dreams moves to New York City and becomes an identical cog who learns to love the machine of modernity." data-gatsby-head="true"/> The Man and The Crow…
